name: Hilton Osaka

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights 3 adults & 3 kids in two connecting rooms. I really have no complaints whatsoever except to unavailability(charging) of the pool for guests. We stayed one night at the ANA crown plaza & the Hilton is better in every regard except the ANA allows free use of their pool, which is a big plus for young children. The biggest plus of this holel is also its location above the main Osaka train station and several underground train lines, you rarely have to change trains for any of the main attractions. The airport bus stop is just over the road (the ANA 20 mins walk away also uses this stop )although we used the train to the airport. All the staff from the restraunt,cleaners,consiege & reception were very polite & efficient. I am not a big fan of Japanese decor but the rooms were clean, well maintained & relatively new.
reviews.title: very very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If they didn't charge for the pool & internet it would be perfect.
reviews.title: Great location for trains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved staying at this hotel. The staff here is excellent especially the executive lounge staff. The breakfast buffet is very good. The gym is great and the locker area has traditional Japanese bath facilities, which are better than the Tokyo Hilton's. The rooms are almost identical to the Tokyo Hilton's except the bathrooms are more modern. Besides the hotel being amazing, the location is great for getting around the city. It sits on top of a subway station and it is across the street from the JR station, which is one stop away from the shinkansen (bullet train) station. This made our day trip to Kyoto very easy since we just crossed the street to catch the train for the 30 minute ride.
reviews.title: Great service, great staff

reviews.text: Be aware that if you take the airport limo from Itami airport that it doesn't actually stop at the hotel. It lets you out across the street at another hotel. The Kansai limo bus goes directly to the hotel.
reviews.title: One of the best Hiltons
Excellent hotel for business travellers
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night at the end of our trip to Japan and what stood out for me was the genuine desire of staff to ensure we were looked after from the minute we arrived here until the minute we left. We stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Kyoto and there was a discernable difference in the level of warmth we felt at both places. The Osaka Hilton felt much more welcoming.

The Hilton in Osaka was where we headed for our first few nights in Japan, the service was great and after a long flight, we were promptly shown our room. The room was great, nice and room with two huge beds. The bathrooms were nice, and had an awesome Japanese style bidet - very cool. Ordered room service on the first night, was quite pricey but also very good. The sky bar was amazing but also quite pricey. The location was great, very central to Osaka with stations very accessible. My only negative was that internet was not free in the room!
reviews.title: Great Location, Amazing Building

reviews.text: It is located pretty much right at Osaka subway and JR lines, which made tourin the city very convenient. The room was much bigger than we anticipated after staying in a tiny hotel in Tokyo. The view was also phenomenal. My only complaint is that I needed to pay to use the internet. I stayed in 3 star hotels before where the internet was free so this surprised me. Otherwise, the staff, rooms and location are all fantastic.
reviews.title: Great location but expensive internet.

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton Osaka for the first night of a trip to Japan and chose the hotel as I had stayed for a night in 2007. Took airport bus number 5 from Kansai airport which dropped me right at the front door to the hotel after a one hour journey. The bus was much more convenient than my memories of travelling by train on my previous visit.
reviews.title: Convenient but unjustifiable charges

reviews.text: Check-in was quick and my room on the 29th floor was large (by European standards) and had execellent city view.
reviews.title: Short stay, but very nice hotel...

reviews.text: We stayed in Osaka Hilton for a few nites in October. We plan to visit a very local Japanese fish house in a local area for dinner, however, when we approached the first Bell Captain who is a short guy (don't remember his name, but I believe he is more senior than Shimada San) for help, he started to say our fish house address is wrong, blah blah blah, very rude, and not willing to help.
reviews.title: Shimada San Bell Captain is very helpful!

reviews.text: Then the next day, we asked Shimada San another Bell Captain about the fish house, he instantly googled the exact location of the fish house, printed out the address so that we could show it to the taxi driver. He also explained a bit about the local Osaka food. Very informative and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent location - nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next time, when you stay in Hilton Osaka, and need some local information, look for Shimada San, he is more than willing to help.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: Hilton Osaka is a very luxurious hotel located very close to Osaka central train station (several subaway stations available), and one subway station away from Shin-Osaka Shinkansen station. Hotel itself is splendid : very nice and modern rooms with a japanese touch, a very good sport center (fitness, swimming pool, massages..). It is located in a busy disctrict with a lot of bars, small restaurant & shop in the vicinity. This hotel is maybe a bit expensive but it is worth.
reviews.title: Very luxurious hotel in the heart of Osaka

reviews.text: First, let me say I love Japan (note my handle). Mostly because I've rarely had a bad trip anywhere in the country. That being said, it's hard sometimes to find something unique about a chain hotel; so you limit surprises. Well, the Hilton Osaka is a cut above the rest of the Hiltons. Outstanding location, next to the Osaka rail station. People are fantastic. Upgraded to the executive level didn't hurt obviously, but the hotel and its amenities are great. Health club/fitness center is fantastic. The executive level concierge and the breakfasts are top notch. Location is perfect. Had a great time. Not quite the level of the Imperial Hotel in Tokyo, but at half the price....no complaints!
reviews.title: Did I like Hilton Osaka? I cancelled my hotel in Kyoto to stay here longer!

reviews.text: What could have been a bad experience turned into a perfect one for us at the Hilton Osaka, due to the incredible attention of the staff. We had hoped for a babysitter to enjoy our last night but none were available from the agency. However the staff made a huge effort to solve this for us and went to great lengths to ensure we had a wonderful dinner and evening out. From the moment we arrived to walking out the door the staff were incredible to us and to our young child. Convenient location and the food is fantastic too.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: I booked two rooms for four nights. According to hotel policy, the rooms should have been available for check-in at 2:00 in the afternoon. We arrived from the airport at almost exactly 2:00, but it was two hours before our rooms were ready. Then, it took three tries (and three trips downstairs to the lobby) before the card keys worked correctly. Hotel staff were unfriendly, bordering on rude. I didn't mind the room rates, but other costs in the hotel are atrocious. One glass of Coke in the lobby was the equivalent of $8 USD. The least-expensive menu in the hotel's Japanese restaurant was the equivalent of $600 USD for 3 diners. (And I was the only one who had a glass of wine.) All of the "new movies" on the hotel's entertainment system were over a year old. One afternoon, I stopped in the lobby cafe because they were advertising afternoon tea on their billboard. The waitress brought me a menu and opened it to the page promoting afternoon tea with finger sandwiches, scones, etc. When I requested tea set for one, I was told they had sold out of that menu item. Then why continue promoting it? This hotel experience completely soured me on Hilton properties.
reviews.title: Unfriendly & Over-Priced

reviews.text: The Osaka Hilton looks impressive. It stands out in the Osaka skyline (particularly useful if you don't speak or read Japanese). Inside the large foyer, guests are greeted with a scale-model train set. Rooms aren't massive but are comfortable enough (the toilets are an experience!). The staff all speak English and are helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Good location, but beware the hidden costs...

description: Set in the business and entertainment area, the Hilton Osaka hotel is linked to one of Osaka's largest shopping malls. Admire the views from Windows on the World restaurant or the Executive Lounge. Unwind in the gym, pool or relaxation salon. The hotel is 3 miles from Universal Studios Japan and 1 hour from Kansai airport.
